comments.raw_text:
In older versions of Firefox/Chatzilla, you could close all browser windows, leaving Chatzilla open, but when you clicked on an http:// link in ChatZilla, it would pop up a new browser window and go to the link.

Now if you close all browser windows but leave Chatzilla running, you're pretty much hosed -- you can't open any links by clicking on them, and there is no other mechanism to open a browser window, so you have to shut down ChatZilla, and then re-launch Firefox so that you can surf the web again.

This is a major UX failure!

I suspect is brought on by the change where instead of opening a new window you guys just shoot clicked-on links into a tab.
comments.author: wes@page.ca
